data.title: FOX Sports Presents Exclusive BIG EAST Tournament Coverage Live From Madison Square Garden In 5G
data.meta_description: FOX Sports returns to New York City’s Madison Square Garden with its elite roster of award-winning and Hall of Fame broadcasters for exclusive coverage of the 2021 BIG EAST Men’s Basketball Tournament live on FOX and FS1 from Wednesday, March 10, through Saturday, March 13. The network offers enhanced viewing options, as the ‘Megalodon’ camera makes its college basketball debut and the tournament is transmitted in 5G for the first time ever.
data.text:
Award-Winning and Hall of Fame Broadcasters Headline On-Air Lineup

Critically Acclaimed ‘Megalodon’ Camera Makes College Basketball Debut

NEW YORK – FOX Sports returns to New York City’s Madison Square Garden with its elite roster of award-winning and Hall of Fame broadcasters for exclusive coverage of the 2021 BIG EAST Men’s Basketball Tournament live on FOX and FS1 from Wednesday, March 10, through Saturday, March 13. The network offers enhanced viewing options, as the ‘Megalodon’ camera makes its college basketball debut and the tournament is transmitted in 5G for the first time ever.

FOX Sports lead play-by-play announcer and 2021 recipient of CoSIDA’s Jake Wade Award Gus Johnson joins Emmy Award winner Bill Raftery to call the tournament’s Thursday night quarterfinals before teaming with former All-American and NBA veteran Jim Jackson, a member of the Collegiate Basketball Hall of Fame’s Class of 2021, for the semifinals and championship. Veteran play-by-play announcer Tim Brando calls Wednesday’s first-round games with Raftery and Thursday’s afternoon quarterfinals with Jackson.

Host Rob Stone is live from FOX Sports’ Los Angeles studios for the duration of the tournament, sitting alongside former UCLA and St. John’s head coach Steve Lavin and former UConn standout Donny Marshall for bridge and postgame coverage throughout the tournament, plus half-hour pregame shows before Friday’s semifinals and Saturday’s championship. Bracket expert Mike DeCourcy joins throughout the week with the latest NCAA Tournament projections.

Viewers will be treated to unique and impressive visuals during the 2021 BIG EAST Tournament with the return of FOX Sports RailCam, plus the college basketball debut of ‘Megalodon,’ a live wireless camera that produces ultra-vivid imagery integrated seamlessly within a live telecast. FOX Sports debuted Megalodon during the NFL season to critical acclaim and has since activated the fan-favorite for its coverage of the Daytona 500 as well as Liga MX on FOX Deportes. This year’s tournament will be transmitted from Madison Square Garden in 5G, resulting in crisper and more reliable feed with less on-site cabling.

FOX Sports’ college basketball coverage can be streamed live on the new FOX Sports app and FOXSports.com, which also offer bonus “Above the Rim” viewing options for all games of the tournament. Also on the app, website, @CBBonFOX social platforms and YouTube, Mark Titus and Tate Frazier preview the BIG EAST Tournament on Tuesday’s episode of the popular Titus & Tate podcast and provide additional coverage all month long, including live and interactive Selection Sunday “Watch With” and bracket reaction specials.

FOX Sports’ complete 2021 BIG EAST Tournament programming schedule is below.

For more information, visit FOX Sports Press Pass and follow @FOXSportsPR on Twitter.

About FOX Sports

FOX Sports is the umbrella entity representing FOX Corporation’s wide array of multi-platform US-based sports assets. Built with brands capable of reaching more than 100 million viewers in a single weekend, the business has ownership and interests in linear television networks, digital and mobile programming, broadband platforms, multiple web sites, joint-venture businesses and several licensing relationships. FOX Sports includes the sports television arm of the FOX Network; FS1, FS2, FOX Soccer Plus and FOX Deportes. FOX Sports’ digital properties include FOXSports.com and the FOX Sports App, which provides live streaming video of FOX Sports content, instant scores, stats and alerts to iOS and Android devices. Additionally, FOX Sports and social broadcasting platform Caffeine jointly own Caffeine Studios which creates exclusive eSports, sports and live entertainment content. Also included in FOX Sports’ portfolio are FOX’s interests in joint-venture business Big Ten Network, a licensing and commercial relationship with The Stars Group that created the FOX Bet sports betting platform and the FOX Bet Super 6 free-to-play game, as well as a licensing agreement that established the FOX Sports Radio Network.
